Translations.Text: Then there succeeded to them a posterity who neglected the prayers and followed lusts; so presently they shall meet with perdition
Excepting those who may repent and believe and work righteously; these shall enter the Garden and shall not be wronged at all
Gardens Everlasting, which the Compassionate hath promised unto his bondmen, unseen; verily His premise is ever to be fulfilled
They shall not hear therein any vain word, but they shall hear only peace; and therein they shall have their provision morning and evening
Such is the Garden which We shall cause those of Our bondmen to inherit who have been God-fearing
And we descend not except by the command of thy Lord: his is whatsoever is before us and whatsoever is behind us and whatsoever is in-between; and thy Lord is not a forgetter
Lord of the heavens and the earth and that which is betwixt the twain; so Him worship thou, and endure patiently in His worship; knowest thou any as his compeer
And man saith: when I am daed, Shall I be presently brought forth alive
Remembereth not man that We created him afore when he was not aught
By thy Lord, then, We shall surely gather them and the satans; thereafter We shall surely bring them round Hell, kneeling
Thereafter, We shall surely draw aside, from each sect, whichever of them against the Compassionate were most in excess
Then surely it is We who are the Best Knower of these worthiest of being therein roasted
And not one of you but shall pass over it: it is for thy Lord an ordinance decreed
Then We shall deliver those who have feared, and shall have the wrong-doers therein kneeling
And when Our manifest revelations are rehearsed unto them, those who disbelieve say unto those who believe: which of the two portions is better in station and goodlier in company
And how many a generation have We destroyed before these, who were goodlier in goods and outward appearance

Say thou: whosoever is in error--surely unto him the Compassionate lengtheneth a length, until When they behold that wherewith they were threatened, either the torment or the Hour, then they shall come to know whosoever is worse in position and weaker as an army
And Allah increaseth in guidance those who let themselves be guided, and the righteous works that last are excellent with thy Lord in respect of reward and excellent in respect of return
Hast thou observed him who disbelieveth in Our signs and saith: surely I shall be vouchsafed riches and children
Hath he looked unto the Unseen, or hath he taken of the Compassionate a covenant
By no means! We shall write down that which he saith; and We shall lengthen for him of the torment a length
And We shall inherit from him that whereof he spake, and he shall come to us alone
And they have taken gods beside Allah that they might be unto them a glory
By no means! anon they shall deny their worship, and become unto them an adversary
Beholdest thou not that We have sent the satans upon the infidels inciting them by an incitement
So hasten thou not against them; We are only counting against them a counting
On the Day whereon We shall gather the God-feaing unto the Com- passionate as an embassy
And shall drive the culprits to Hell as a herd
They shall not own intercession, excepting those who have taken of the Compassionate a covenant
And they say: the Compassionate hath taken a son
Assuredly ye have brought a thing monstrous
Well-nigh the heavens are rent thereat and the earth cleft in sunder and the mountains fall down in pieces
That they should ascribe unto the Compassionate a son
And it behoveth not the Compassionate that he should take a son
None there is in the heavens and the earth but must come unto the Compassionate as a bondman
Assuredly He hath comprehanded them and counted them a full Counting
And each of them is to come to Him on the Day of Judgment alone
Verily those who believe and do righteOUs works--anon the Compassionate shall appoint for them affection
So We have made it easy in thine tongue in order that thou mayest thereby give glad tidings unto the Godfearing and warn thereby a people contentious
And how many a generation have We destroyed before them! Perceivest thou of them anyone or hear of them a whisper
